title: Activist Shaun King says Meta banned him from Instagram because of his pro-Palestinian stance
description: Meta has banned social justice activist Shaun King from Instagram, and he claims his account was disabled because he posted support for Palestinians in the Israel-Hamas war.

title: Appeals court tosses former Rep. Jeff Fortenberry's conviction on lying to federal authorities
description: The court said Jeff Fortenberry’s trial in Los Angeles was an improper venue because he made false statements during interviews with agents in Nebraska and Washington, D.C.

title: Coast Guard suspends search for man who went overboard on cruise ship
description: The U.S. Coast Guard has suspended its search for a 41-year-old man who went overboard on a cruise ship just before Christmas, it said Monday.

title: Missing pregnant teen who is past her delivery date may be in danger, Texas officials say
description: Authorities in Texas are searching for a pregnant teen who is past her delivery date and believed to be in danger.

title: Vivek Ramaswamy's campaign stops all TV ad spending less than a month before Iowa and New Hampshire
description: Vivek Ramaswamy’s presidential campaign has stopped spending money on television ads and does not have any TV ad reservations booked, according to his campaign and data from an ad tracking firm.

title: Instagram influencer fatally shot by husband days after she was granted a restraining order against him
description: An Instagram influencer was fatally shot near a Hawaii mall by her husband two days after a judge granted her a restraining order against the man, who later was found dead in an apparent suicide, according to authorities and court documents.

title: How snowstorms in the Great Plains could affect the holiday travel rush
description: Snowstorms across the Great Plains could cause delays as millions of people are expected to travel before the weekend. NBC News’ Maura Barrett reports on how packed airports are getting and Michelle Grossman gives the forecast.

title: First Amendment claim struck down in Project Veritas case focused on diary of Biden's daughter
description: The judge rejected the First Amendment arguments regarding the alleged theft of Ashley Biden's diary, saying they were “inconsistent with Supreme Court precedent.”

title: Hugh Jackman cops to getting a little too close to Rockefeller Center Christmas tree
description: Hugh Jackman's happy feet almost got him into trouble.

title: Americans ramped up spending during the holidays despite some financial anxiety and higher costs
description: Holiday sales rose this year and spending remained resilient during the shopping season even with Americans wrestling with higher prices in some areas and other financial worries, according to the latest measure.

title: 'The Color Purple' rakes in $18M, the largest Christmas Day opening for a film since '09
description: “The Color Purple,” a vibrant adaptation of the book-turned-beloved-movie-turned-hit-Broadway-musical, dominated at the box office on Christmas Day.

title: Ken Jennings says he was caught 'off guard' by Mayim Bialik's 'Jeopardy!' exit
description: All-time "Jeopardy!" great and show host Ken Jennings has said he was caught "off guard" by the removal of co-host Mayim Bialik from the nightly podium.

title: Ye apologizes in Hebrew to Jewish community for 'unplanned' antisemitic 'outburst'
description: Ye, the rapper formerly known as Kanye West, apologized in Hebrew to the Jewish community for his "unplanned" antisemitic "outburst" earlier this month.

title: Husband of late Phoenix prosecutor fatally shoots girlfriend, her mom and then himself, police say
description: The widower of a prominent Arizona prosector, who died shortly after leaving office last year, fatally shot his girlfriend and her mother before turning the gun on himself, police said Tuesday.

title: Patients get more infections and fall more often at private equity-owned hospitals
description: Patients receiving care at hospitals owned by private-equity firms get more bloodstream and surgical site infections and fall more often, says a new study in the Journal of the American Medical Association.

title: Blizzard conditions roll through northern and central Plains, snarling post-Christmas travel
description: Seven million people were under winter weather alerts Tuesday as the Plains and parts of the Midwest experience blizzard conditions that have already led to dozens of weather-related incidents over the Christmas holiday.

title: Four children and their mom were found dead on Christmas Day in France
description: Four children between nine months and 10 years old and their mother were killed in their apartment east of Paris, in what the local prosecutor called an exceptionally violent crime.

title: North Carolina toddler opens entire family's Christmas presents at 3 a.m.
description: A North Carolina couple woke up on Christmas morning to what they described as one of "the most terrifying things a parent can be woken up by": Their 3-year-old loudly requesting a pair of scissors.

title: U.S. bans imports of certain Apple Watches that may infringe on patented pulse readers
description: The U.S. has officially banned imports of certain Apple Watch models after the Biden administration declined to veto an agency's decision to restrict the products.

title: Remains found in wooded area of Virginia identified as boy who went missing in 2003
description: Human remains found in a wooded area in Carroll County, Virginia, have been identified as those belonging to a 5-year-old boy who disappeared in 2003, authorities said.

title: Clerk in Alex Murdaugh trial accused of plagiarizing passage in book about her role
description: Rebecca Hill, who is at the center of a jury tampering claim by Murdaugh's defense team, is being accused of plagiarism by the publisher of her book.

title: The right to protest is under threat in Britain, undermining a pillar of democracy
description: For holding a sign outside a courthouse reminding jurors of their right to acquit defendants, a retiree faces up to two years in prison.  For hanging a banner reading Just Stop Oil off a bridge, an engineer got a three-year prison sentence. Just for walking slowly down the street, scores of people have been arrested.

title: Lose a limb or risk death? Many in Gaza face an agonizing choice
description: Many among the more than 54,500 war-wounded in Gaza face a gut-wrenching choice: Lose a limb or risk death.

title: Schools in 41 states have spent millions on pouches to lock up kids' phones
description: School districts in 41 states have spent $2.5 million to buy phone pouches from Yondr, according to Govspend, a database of government contracts and purchases.

title: Derek Hough and his wife, Hayley Erbert, share Christmas pic after her emergency brain surgery
description: Derek Hough and his wife, Hayley Erbert, cherished “the precious gift of life and the love” they share in a sweet photo together on Christmas as Erbert recovers from emergency brain surgery for bleeding in her skull.

title: No one wins Powerball Christmas Day jackpot as prize grows to $685M
description: Those who wished to win the estimated $660 million Powerball jackpot for Christmas this year were let down, but may have another chance Wednesday as the prize pot grows to $685 million.

title: Efforts to protect child influencers will continue to ramp up in 2024
description: Efforts to protect child influencers will continue to ramp up in 2024. Some experts say the legislative action — while welcome — is long overdue.

title: Ron DeSantis' big gamble and the dangers of very early puberty: Morning Rundown
description: Backers of Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis’ presidential bid placed a big bet on how to get him elected that faces steep odds.

title: Reparations gained historic momentum in 2023 because of California’s efforts
description: After a blockbuster 1,000 page report, California's reparations advocates will have to convert recommendations from its statewide task force into policies — and convincing voters to pay for it.

title: LIVE BLOG
description: Follow NBC News for the latest live updates on the Israel-Hamas war as Ron Dermer, an adviser to Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu travels to the U.S.

title: 2024 wild card: A banner year for third-party candidates
description: Unenthusiastic about either of their likely choices for president, many Americans say they want more, seeding the ground for a possible bumper crop of third-party and independent presidential candidates next year.

title: Ron DeSantis' big bet on door-knocking put to the test in Iowa
description: Never Back Down, a super PAC backing Ron DeSantis, has bet big on door-knocking in Iowa. Will that strategy pay off?

title: What could happen in the Russia-Ukraine war in 2024?
description: At the start of 2023, hopes were high that a Ukrainian counteroffensive would turn the tide in the war against Russia. It didn’t, and 2024 could be even harder.

title: Lahaina residents’ desperate need for housing months after wildfire devastation
description: Months after the devastating Maui wildfires, residents of Lahaina are honoring those killed. Many fire victims are struggling and in need of housing, with the governor weighing new measures to help. NBC News’ Dana Griffin reports.
